Job Title: Stormwater Superintendent

Location: Greater Chattanooga

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Project Management, Science

Description:
Position: Stormwater SuperintendentIndustry: Field ServicesLocation: Chattanooga, TN (100% Travel - must be based out of the Chattanooga, TN area)Salary: $65,000 - $75,000 (Depending on Experience)
Are you highly motivated, hard-working, and seeking to join a growth-focused environmental consulting & engineering firm? Are you looking for a company that will invest in your development and grow your professional skills? If so, consider a career with Apex.Powered by record sales, extraordinary client retention, strategic acquisitions, and an entrepreneurial spirit, Apex Companies is one of the fastest growing environmental consulting and engineering firms in the US. We take pride in keeping our clients happy and have earned numerous awards for project excellence. We continue to grow, and we want you to grow with us.
Your Responsibilities as a Stormwater Superintendent: Manage stormwater and wet utility-related projects and repairs.Inspect, identify and assess stormwater-related deficiencies and compliance-driven repairs.Supervises work of others, including planning, assigning, and scheduling work, reviewing work, and ensuring quality standards, training staff, and overseeing their productivity.Manage subcontractors/field personnel and assist with procuring pricing for necessary repairs.Maintain relationships with subcontractors and vendors.Communicate with subcontractors on the scope of work during the proposal process.Direct subcontractor on completion of the approved scope of work, to keep them on schedule and to adhere to the proposed budget.Travel throughout the Tennessee region and surrounding states to job sites.Ensure project work quality during all completion efforts throughout the project.Document project progress and provide daily updates to Project Management Team.Assist the Field Manager with scheduling project start dates.Procure necessary job materials.Identify and assist with resolving potential project-related complications.Promote and enforce all applicable safety rules and regulations.Repair post-construction stormwater infrastructure, concrete structures, underground utilities, and stormwater basins when crews need assistance.Operate hand-held, power tools, and heavy construction equipment (e.g. skid loader, backhoe, excavator).Apply construction and regulatory compliance techniques.
Why you'll love working for us: Company-subsidized medical and dental.Company-paid life, short, and long-term disability.401k match, tuition assistance, and more.Cross-training and the ability to work on a variety of projects.Performance-based bonuses or other incentives.Working with the best and brightest in the industry.1,200+ employee national firm with 50+ locations across the US.
What we're looking for:GED or High School Diploma.OSHA HAZWOPER certification.Ability to travel extensively and out of town work.Commercial Contractor Licensing a plus.Experience with stormwater/drainage construction, concrete or asphalt paving experience, or wet utility work a must.2 years of related experience.Experience with Deltek Vision is highly desired.Valid driver's license and good driving record.Ability to pass pre-employment background and drug screen.Thorough understanding of safe work practices in accordance with OSHA regulations.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
